XmlWorldData.name: Glass Walls Tutorial
XmlWorldData.description: This tutorial will teach you about "glass walls" which can keep characters from falling off the edge of the world.
XmlWorldData.creator: scoy

Step.GamepadText:
This tutorial will teach you about "Glass Walls". Glass Walls are invisible barriers at the edge of your world which keep characters from falling off.
First, we'll start with Glass Walls turned off. In this world we've got a turtle <turtle> who is programmed to move forward. Let's see what happens when he gets to the edge of the world.

First, we'll start with Glass Walls turned off. In this world we've got a turtle <turtle> who is programmed to move forward. Let's see what happens when he gets to the edge of the world.

Step.Comment: Run the game, wait until turtle goes away.

Step.GamepadText:
Okay, the turtle <turtle> fell off the edge of the world.
Now let's turn on Glass Walls for the world and see what happens. You can toggle whether Glass Walls are on or off from the World Settings menu <WorldSettings>.
Step.MouseText:
Okay, the turtle <turtle> fell off the edge of the world.
Now let's turn on Glass Walls for the world and see what happens. You can toggle whether Glass Walls are on or off from the World Settings menu <WorldSettings>.
Step.TouchText:
Okay, the turtle <turtle> fell off the edge of the world.
Now let's turn on Glass Walls for the world and see what happens. You can toggle whether Glass Walls are on or off from the World Settings menu <WorldSettings>.

Step.Comment: Getting to world settings. Just follow the crumbs.

Step.GamepadText: Use the left stick <leftstick> to scroll down to the Glass Walls tile and then press <A> to turn them on. When you are done, press <b> to exit the World Settings menu <WorldSettings>.
Step.MouseText: Use the arrow keys [uparrow][downarrow] to scroll down to the Glass Walls tile and then press [Enter] to turn them on. You can also use the mouse to click <leftmouse> on the tile to bring it into focus and to turn it on and off. When you are done, press [esc] to exit the World Settings menu <WorldSettings>.
Step.TouchText: Press and drag to scroll down to the Glass Walls tile and then tap to turn them on. When you are done, tap the Back button to exit the World Settings menu <WorldSettings>.

Step.GamepadText: Okay, now we can play the game again and see what happens.
Step.MouseText: Okay, now we can play the game again and see what happens.
Step.TouchText: Okay, now we can play the game again and see what happens.

Step.GamepadText:
Good job! You've just learned what Glass Walls are and how to turn them on or off in the World Settings menu <WorldSettings>.
Let's try changing the Sky Color which is also controlled in the World Settings menu <WorldSettings>.
Step.MouseText:
Good job! You've just learned what Glass Walls are and how to turn them on or off in the World Settings menu <WorldSettings>.
Let's try changing the Sky Color which is also controlled in the World Settings menu <WorldSettings>.
Step.TouchText:
Good job! You've just learned what Glass Walls are and how to turn them on or off in the World Settings menu <WorldSettings>.
Let's try changing the Sky Color which is also controlled in the World Settings menu <WorldSettings>.

Step.Comment: Getting to world settings. Just follow the crumbs.

Step.GamepadText: Use the left stick <leftstick> to scroll down to the Sky Color tile and then use the left stick <leftstick> to choose a new color. When you are done, press <b> to exit the World Settings menu <WorldSettings>.
Step.MouseText: Use the arrow keys [uparrow][downarrow] to scroll down to the Sky Color tile and then use [leftarrow][rightarrow] to choose a new color. When you are done, press [esc] to exit the World Settings menu <WorldSettings>.
Step.TouchText: Press and drag to scroll down to the Sky Color tile and then tap to choose a new color. When you are done, tap the Back button to exit the World Settings menu <WorldSettings>.

Step.GamepadText: Okay, now we can play the game again and see how it looks with the new Sky Color.
Step.MouseText: Okay, now we can play the game again and see how it looks with the new Sky Color.
Step.TouchText: Okay, now we can play the game again and see how it looks with the new Sky Color.

Step.GamepadText:
Good job! You've now learned about Glass Walls and changing the Sky Color in the World Settings <WorldSettings> menu.
Take some time and explore the other options in the World Settings menu <WorldSettings>. You can get more detailed help for each of them by pressing <y> when on the tile.
Step.MouseText:

Take some time and explore the other options in the World Settings menu <WorldSettings>. You can get more detailed help for each of them by pressing [F1] or clicking <leftmouse> on the help tile.

Take some time and explore the other options in the World Settings menu <WorldSettings>. You can get more detailed help for each of them by tapping on the help tile.
